gurmukhi: c`kRq BeI ggn kI qrnI dyv Adyv qRswey ] inrKq BXo sUr rQ QMBq nYn inmyKn lwey ]
transliteration: Chakkrat Bhaigadan Kitarnidev Adev Tasaae|| Nirkhat Bhayo Soor Rath Thanbhat Nain Nimekhan Laae||
translation: The heavenly damsels were wonder-struck; the gods and demons felt agitated; the sun-god stopped his chariot in order to see that war;

gurmukhi: S`sqR A`sqR nwnw ibiD C`fy bwx pRXog clwey ] mwnhu mhwN myG bUMdn ijXoN bwx bXUh brswey ]
transliteration: Shasstra Asstra Naanaa Bidh(i) Chhadde Baan Prayog Chadhaae|| Maanoh Mahaan Megh Boondan Jiyon Baan Badooh Barsaae||
translation: He saw that various types of arms and weapons were being used in that fighting; the arrows were being showered like rain-drops;

gurmukhi: ctpt crm brm pr ctky dwJq qiRxw ljwey ] sRoxq Bry bsqR soiBq jnu cwcr Kyl isDwey ]26]100]
transliteration: Chatpat Charam Baram Par Chatke Daajhat Trinaa Lajaae|| Sronat Bhare Bastra Sobhit Jan(u) Chaachar Khel Sidhaae||26||100||
translation: The arrows hitting the armours were producing the crackling sound and it seems that the sparks are bursting forth with the burning of the straw; the clothes saturated with blood gave the semblance of the playing of Holi.26.100.

gurmukhi: ieh ibD BXo Awhv Gor ] BwNiq BwNiq igry Drw pr sUr suMdR ikSor ]
transliteration: Eh Bidh Bhayo Aahav Ghor|| Bhaant(i) Bhaant(i) Gire Dharaa Par Soor Soundra Kishor||
translation: In this way, there was a dreadful fighting and the fine warriors fell upon the earth;

gurmukhi: kop kop hTI GtI rn S`sqR AsqR clwie ] jUiJ jUiJ igry idvwlX Fol bol bjwie ]
transliteration: Kop Kop Hathighatiran Shasstra Astra Chadhaae|| Joojh(i) Joojh(i) Gire Divaalaya Dhol Bol Bajaae||
translation: Those persistent warriors in their fury struck their arms and weapons and sounding their drums and trumpets and fighting bravely, they tell upon the ground;

gurmukhi: hwie hwie BeI jhwN qh Bwj Bwj subIr ] pYT pYT gey qRIAw lY hwr hwr ADIr ]
transliteration: Haae Haae Bhaijahaan Tah Bhaaj Bhaaj Soubeer|| Paith Paith Gad Treeaa Lai Haar Haar Adheer||
translation: The sound of lamentation was heard on all sides and the warriors ran hither and thither; on this side they were falling on the earth and on that side the heavenly damsels getting agitated were putting wreaths around their necks and wedding them;

gurmukhi: ApRmwn Cuty srwn idswn BXo AMiDAwr ] tUk tUk pry jhwN qh mwr mwr juJwr ]27]101]
transliteration: Apramaan Choute Saraan Disaan Bhayo Andhiaar|| Took Took Dare Jahaan Tah Maar Maar Jujhaar||27||101||
translation: The darkness spread on the discharge of innumerable arrows and the dead warriors were seen scattered hither and thither in bits.27.101.

gurmukhi: mwrU Sbdu suhwvn bwjy ] jy jy huqy suBt rx suMdr gih gih AwXuD gwjy ]
transliteration: Maroo Shabad(u) Suhaavan Baaje|| Je Je Houte Soubhat Ran Soundar Gadh Gadh Aayudh Gadje||
translation: The deadly musical instruments were played in the wararena and all the fine warriors holding their weapons in their hands thundered;

gurmukhi: kvc phr pwKr so fwrI AaurY AwXuD swjy ] Bry gumwn suBt isMGn jXoN Awhv BUm ibrwjy ]
transliteration: Kavach Pahar Paakhar So Daari Aurai Aayudh Saaje|| Bhare Goumaan Soubhat Singhan Jyon Aahav Bhoom Biraaje||
translation: Wearing their armours and striking all the warriors were fighting in the battlefield like lions filled with pride;

gurmukhi: gih gih cly gdw gwjI sB suBt AXoDn kwjy ] Awhv BUim sUr As soBy inrK ieMdR duiq lwjy ]
transliteration: Gadh Gadh Chale Gadaa Gadjisabh Soubhat Ayodhan Kaaje|| Aahav Bhoom(i) Soor As Sobhe Nirakh Indra Dout(i) Laaje||
translation: Holding their maces, the fighters moved for fighting, these warriors looked splendid in the battlefield and even Indra on seeing them and their elegance was feeling shy;

gurmukhi: tUk tUk hUAY igry Drn pr Awhv Cor n Bwjy ] pRwpq Bey dyv mMdr kh SsqRn suBt invwjy ]28]102]
transliteration: Took Took Hooai Gire Dharan Par Aahav Chhodh Na Bhaaje|| Praapat Bhae Dev Mandar Kah Shastran Soubhat Nivaaje||28||102||
translation: They were falling on the ground having been cut into bits, but they were not running away from the battlefield; they were embracing death and were moving into the worlds of gods alonwith their weapons.28.102.
